org.dsa.iot.dslink

Class DSLinkHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dsa.iot.dslink.DSLinkHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Historian, Main, Main, Main, Requester

    public abstract class DSLinkHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Top level API for handling the configuration of nodes and responses to requests. Note that onRequesterInitialized(org.dsa.iot.dslink.DSLink) and onResponderInitialized(org.dsa.iot.dslink.DSLink) can be each called for the same link ID. This allows for the node managers to be completely isolated between a a requester and responder.

    • Method Detail

      • getLinkData

        public JsonObject getLinkData()
        The default setting from here is what is used in the Configuration instance during an auto configuration. The result must be strictly static.
        Returns:
        The extra link data that can be used by any requester.

      • isResponder

        public boolean isResponder()
        The default setting from here is what is used in the Configuration instance during an auto configuration. The result must be strictly static.
        Returns:
        Whether this DSLink is a responder or not.

      • isRequester

        public boolean isRequester()
        The default setting from here is what is used in the Configuration instance during an auto configuration. The result must be strictly static.
        Returns:
        Whether this DSLink is a requester or not.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the entire DSLink. The DSLink is expected to close all resources and stop all threads. This method is called when DSLinkProvider is stopped. SDK resources such as Objects should not be shut down here. However, all locally created thread pools must be shut down. Any scheduled tasks created in any thread pool must be shut down.

      • setConfig

        public void setConfig(Configuration configuration)
        Sets the configuration of the handler.
        Parameters:
        configuration - Configuration of the link

      • getConfig

        public Configuration getConfig()
        Returns:
        Configuration of the DSLink

      • setProvider

        public void setProvider(DSLinkProvider provider)
        Sets the provider that is attached to this handler.
        Parameters:
        provider - DSLink provider.

      • getProvider

        public DSLinkProvider getProvider()
        Returns:
        DSLink provider attached to this DSLink.

      • preInit

        public void preInit()
        Pre initializes the handler. If this link is a responder any actions must be populated here.

      • onRequesterInitialized

        public void onRequesterInitialized(DSLink link)
        This method is asynchronously called. The link is not yet connected to the server.
        Parameters:
        link - The link that needs to be initialized.

      • onRequesterConnected

        public void onRequesterConnected(DSLink link)
        This method is asynchronously called. The link is connected to the server at this stage.
        Parameters:
        link - The link that has completed a connection.

      • onRequesterDisconnected

        public void onRequesterDisconnected(DSLink link)
        The link has lost a connection from the server.
        Parameters:
        link - The link that has been disconnected.

      • onResponderInitialized

        public void onResponderInitialized(DSLink link)
        This method is asynchronously called. The link is not yet connected to the server.
        Parameters:

      • onSubscriptionFail

        public Node onSubscriptionFail(java.lang.String path)
        Callback when a subscription fails as a result of trying to subscribing to a non-existent node.
        Parameters:
        path - Path the requester wants to subscribe to. The path is normalized without a leading forward-slash.
        Returns:
        A created node to force a subscription to succeed or null to let the subscription fail.

      • onInvocationFail

        public Node onInvocationFail(java.lang.String path)
        Callback when an invocation fails as a result of trying to invoke a non-existent node.
        Parameters:
        path - Path the requester is trying to invoke. The path is normalized without a leading forward-flash.
        Returns:
        A created node with an action set on it to force an invocation.

      • onSetFail

        public void onSetFail(java.lang.String path,
                      Value value)
        Callback when a set fails as a result of trying to set on a non-existent node. If the node
        Parameters:
        path - Path the requester wants to set.
        value - Value the requester wants the path to have.
